ml

Class ML

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.ML

  • public class ML
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides stored procedures for machine learning on the Neo4j database. See the attached README for more Information on how to use them.
    Author:
    mwe

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ML.PredictResult
      Used as an object to be returned as a stream to Neo4j and displayed as the result of a stored procedure.
      static class  ML.RowResult
      Used as an object to be returned as a stream to Neo4j and displayed as the result of a stored procedure.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public java.util.stream.Stream<ML.RowResult> create(java.lang.String model,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> types,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> extra,
                                                    boolean timePeriod,
                                                    java.lang.String implementation)
        Creates a new model. Example: CALL ml.create("modelName", {attributeName: "numeric"}, {alpha: 0.1}, {extraAttributeName: "true"}, true)
        Parameters:
        model - the name of the model
        types - the Map of attribute names and their respective data types
        params - the hyperparameters for the specific Machine Learning implementation
        extra - the Map of attributes with constant values the model shall not be trained with but displayed with the result of the prediction
        timePeriod - the boolean that indicates whether a time series shall be predicted or not
        Returns:
        the stream of RowResult

      • add

        public java.util.stream.Stream<ML.RowResult> add(java.lang.String model,
                                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> features,
                                                 java.lang.Object label)
        Adds training data to the model. A match before the call of this procedure is required to select the data.

        The keys of the Map features must be the same as the ones of Map types from the "create" call.

        Example for one feature called "date": MATCH (n:User) CALL ml.add('user', {date: n.date}, n.count) YIELD result RETURN result

        The procedure is called once for every matched row.

        Parameters:
        model - the name of the model
        features - the Map of featureNames and their respective names
        label - the label
        Returns:
        the stream of RowResult

      • train

        public java.util.stream.Stream<ML.RowResult> train(java.lang.String model)
                                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                                   java.lang.InterruptedException
        Trains the model on the added data.
        Parameters:
        model - the name of the model
        Returns:
        the stream of RowResult
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - the interrupted exception

      • predict

        public java.util.stream.Stream<ML.PredictResult> predict(java.lang.String model,
                                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> features)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                                         java.lang.InterruptedException
        Predicts values for the given features on the model. Every key value pair in the features Map stands for one column of a feature.

        The keys of the Map features must be the same as the ones of Map types from the "create" call.

        If period is set to true, features has to look like {start: 20170508, end: 20170515} where the first date value is the start date and the second one the end date. Including those dates, values are automatically predicted for every date in the time period between these two.

        Parameters:
        model - the name of the model
        features - the features
        Returns:
        the stream of PredictResult
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException
